Sentencas: Owing to its excellent ionic conductivity, 20 mol% samarium doped ceria (Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-delta, SDC) is considered a promising alternative as an electrolyte in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Characteristics of Li2CO3 as sintering aid for Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δ electrolyte in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: SDC electrolytes, however, require high sintering temperatures over 1,600 degrees C to attain sufficient density to be SOFC electrolytes.
Titulo: Characteristics of Li2CO3 as sintering aid for Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δ electrolyte in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: To lower the SDC sintering temperature, different amounts of Li2CO3 (0-12 mol% of Li) were evaluated as a sintering aid for SDC electrolytes.
Titulo: Characteristics of Li2CO3 as sintering aid for Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δ electrolyte in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The SDC electrolyte samples with Li were sintered at 1,400 degrees C and were compared with SDC electrolytes sintered at 1,600 degrees C.
Titulo: Characteristics of Li2CO3 as sintering aid for Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δ electrolyte in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The SDC electrolyte with 6 mol% of Li sintered at 1,400 degrees C (Li6SDC1400) was densified to 97.495% of theoretical density (T.D.), which is similar to that achieved by the SDC electrolyte sintered at 1,600 degrees C (97.433% of T.D.).
Titulo: Characteristics of Li2CO3 as sintering aid for Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δ electrolyte in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The improved formation of grain boundary in the Li6SDC1400 sample increased the density of the SDC, resulting in enhancement of ionic conductivity and cell performance.
Titulo: Characteristics of Li2CO3 as sintering aid for Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δ electrolyte in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: At 800 degrees C, the maximum power density of the Li6SDC1400 electrolyte sample was 120.15 mW/cm(2).
Titulo: Characteristics of Li2CO3 as sintering aid for Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δ electrolyte in solid oxide fuel cells
